  • Constructor Details

    • BackpressuringMbox

      public BackpressuringMbox​(MailBox realMbox, java.time.Duration backpressureTimeout, int bufferSize, int requestOnStartup, java.util.concurrent.Executor ayncBackpressurer, java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable>> notDelayed, java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable>> notBackpressurable)
      BackpressuringMbox wrapper for any other mailbox type.
      Parameters:
      realMbox - Backing-up mailbox
      backpressureTimeout - maximum time that should be waited whil attempting to deliver a new message to a saturated mailbox. 0 means immediate fail is delivery is not possible
      bufferSize - how many updates we can cache befor beginning to backpressure new updates. Must be a positive integer
      requestOnStartup - how main messages should be automatically made deliverable on startup. Same semantic of Java Flow Subscription.request
      ayncBackpressurer - Executor used to perform the potentially blocking delivery attempt
      notDelayed - Message types that cannot be wait or backpressured. The delivery will be attempted immediately
      notBackpressurable - Messages that cannot be lost. If a delivery cannot be done immediately the system will wait till when necessary to deliver the message
